Consider a smooth projective curve defined over the field of complex numbers, of genus 2. Let $\Theta_{1}, \Theta_{2}, \Theta_{3}$ be a basis for the space of holomorphic differentials on the curve, and let $\omega$ be a non-zero holomorphic differential of the third kind on the curve. Define the following matrix:
$$M = \begin{pmatrix} (\Theta_{1},\Theta_{1}) & (\Theta_{2},\Theta_{1}) & (\Theta_{3},\Theta_{1}) \\ (\Theta_{1},\Theta_{2}) & (\Theta_{2},\Theta_{2}) & (\Theta_{3},\Theta_{2}) \\ (\Theta_{1},\Theta_{3}) & (\Theta_{2},\Theta_{3}) & (\Theta_{3},\Theta_{3}) \end{pmatrix}$$
where $(\alpha,\beta) = \int_{\gamma}\alpha\wedge\overline{\beta}$ for any pair of differentials $\alpha,\beta$ and a fixed homology basis $\gamma$ on the curve. Find the entries of the inverse matrix $M^{-1}$ in terms of the Riemann theta function $\theta(z)$ and its derivatives.
